intro: Strychnos unguacha var. microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf poison apple, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its small, dark red berries that contain toxic alkaloids. The plant has compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its toxic properties make it a subject of both botanical interest and caution due to its potential dangers. The variety microcarpa is distinguished by its smaller fruits compared to the typical species.
